intro: Ruschia subsphaerica, commonly known as the globe Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, spherical rosettes of fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it an attractive addition to arid landscapes.
